description: crypto/x509: fix typo in Verify documentation

messages.text:
*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=5d3418e4aa1d ***

crypto/x509: fix typo in Verify documentation

R=golang-dev, bradfitz
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5695070

Committer: Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org>

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

LGTM

On Mon, Feb 27, 2012 at 9:11 AM, <krautz@gmail.com> wrote:

> Reviewers: golang-dev_googlegroups.com,
>
> Message:
> Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,
>
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://go.googlecode.com/hg/
>
>
> Description:
> crypto/x509: fix typo in Verify documentation
>
> Please review this at http://codereview.appspot.com/**5695070/<http://codereview.appspot.com/5695070/>
>
> Affected files:
>  M src/pkg/crypto/x509/verify.go
>
>
> Index: src/pkg/crypto/x509/verify.go
> ==============================**==============================**=======
> --- a/src/pkg/crypto/x509/verify.**go
> +++ b/src/pkg/crypto/x509/verify.**go
> @@ -135,8 +135,8 @@
>
>  // Verify attempts to verify c by building one or more chains from c to a
>  // certificate in opts.roots, using certificates in opts.Intermediates if
> -// needed. If successful, it returns one or chains where the first
> element of
> -// the chain is c and the last element is from opts.Roots.
> +// needed. If successful, it returns one or more chains where the first
> +// element of the chain is c and the last element is from opts.Roots.
>  //
>  // WARNING: this doesn't do any revocation checking.
>  func (c *Certificate) Verify(opts VerifyOptions) (chains
> [][]*Certificate, err error) {
>
>
>

subject: code review 5695070: crypto/x509: fix typo in Verify documentation
